com.yantra.ysc.japi.ue

Interface YSCShouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdateUE


  • public interface YSCShouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdateUE
    User exit that determines if update or create operation is granted to the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document shouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdate(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YSCShouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdateUE user exit is called when a data access policy enabled entity is requested for write operation.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdate

        org.w3c.dom.Document shouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdate(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YSCShouldAccessPolicyBeAppliedOnUpdateUE user exit is called when a data access policy enabled entity is requested for write operation. If this user exit is implemented, it determines if data access policy needs to be applied and the internal data access policy will not be considered. The user exit will not be called if the entity belongs to the module specific data access policy such as Catalog and Pricing Entities.

        User Exit Input XML Construction:
        Whenever a data access enabled entity is requested for database access, the access policy manager begins by verifying if this user exit is implemented. If so, the entity and its parent entities information will be converted into an input XML which is then passed to the user exit along with the UserID. If applicable the ClaimAsUserID, and DocumentSearchKey will also be included in the input xml.

        For example, when getOrderLineList is called, the current entity is YFS_ORDER_LINE and its parent entity YFS_ORDER_HEADER. The following input XML will be provided for the user exit: 

           <AccessPolicy UserID="User1" ClaimAsUserID="User5" >
        <Entities>
                <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_LINE" DocumentSearchKey="DocumentSearchKey_01" />
                <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_HEADER" />
        </Entities>
   </AccessPolicy>

        Note that the DocumentSearchKey only appears on the main entity being accessed and does not appear on its parent.

        User Exit Output XML Construction:
        The user exit implementation determines whether a write access should be granted to the user for the list of entites provided from the user exit imput XML. The ApplyAccessPolicy should be set accordingly.

           Sample output:
   <AccessPolicy ApplyAccessPolicy="Y" />
        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called prior to modifying or creating an entity in the database.

        Post-conditions: The return output xml determines if the user has permission for update or insert operation.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. Any XML document that contains all necessary entity information for data access policy validation. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A valid XML containing the required data filter for data access.. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
